title: Inside Trump’s Shifting Stance on Iran
summary: President Trump spent the first months of his term holding back Israel’s push for an assault on Iran’s nuclear program. With the war underway, he has now expressed support for Israel. Jonathan Swan, a White House reporter for The New York Times, breaks down how the president got to this point.

title: How Trump Shifted on Iran Under Pressure From Israel
summary: President Trump spent the first months of his term holding back Israel’s push for an assault on Iran’s nuclear program. With the war underway, his posture has gyrated as he weighs sending in the U.S. military.

title: Iran Is Preparing Missiles for Possible Retaliatory Strikes on U.S. Bases, Officials Say
summary: American commanders have put troops on high alert throughout the region as fears of a wider war grow.

title: What to Know About Israel’s Secretive Nuclear Weapons Program
summary: Since shortly after it was founded in 1948, Israel has been intent on building a nuclear program to ensure its survival.

title: House Policy Bill Would Add $3.4 Trillion to Debt, Swamping Economic Gains
summary: The updated findings from the Congressional Budget Office amounted to the latest dour report card for the president’s signature legislation.

title: The Senate Wants Billions More in Medicaid Cuts, Pinching States and Infuriating Hospitals
summary: Republicans are seeking to limit a tax loophole that gives states more federal matching funds. Many state budgets could be hurt.

title: Brad Lander, NYC Mayoral Candidate, Arrested by ICE Agents at Immigration Courthouse
summary: Mr. Lander, the New York City comptroller and a candidate for mayor, was handcuffed as he tried to steer a man past Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers.

title: Elected Officials Who Have Been Detained in Protests
summary: The arrest of Brad Lander was the latest case in which an official has been held while protesting President Trump’s immigration agenda.

title: $5.4 Million Attack Ad and ICE Arrest Add Drama to N.Y.C. Mayor’s Race
summary: Plus: We looked at key endorsements and dug into the polls with our in-house expert. Primary Day is just a week away.

title: Trump’s Conflicting Messages on Workplace Raids Leave Businesses Reeling
summary: Trump officials insist the president is fully committed to mass deportation. But they have been careful not to directly contradict the president’s attempt to offer a reprieve to certain businesses.

title: Appeals Court Seems Inclined to Let Trump Control National Guard in L.A. for Now
summary: A three-judge panel sounded skeptical of California’s arguments that President Trump should return control of National Guard troops to the state.

title: Mayor Karen Bass Lifts Curfew in Downtown L.A.
summary: Mayor Karen Bass of Los Angeles ended a curfew that began last Tuesday when federal agents, local police officers and protesters clashed on the streets.

title: L.A. Students Graduating Amid ICE Raids Experience Joy and Fear
summary: Nearly three-fourths of the students in L.A. public schools are Latino. Some families, and a few graduates, stayed away from graduation ceremonies out of fear of federal raids.

title: Was Basketball Invented in Herkimer, NY? The Human Calculator Thinks So.
summary: The official story is that Dr. James Naismith invented basketball in Springfield, Mass., in 1891. But what about the teenager tossing cabbages in upstate New York a year earlier?

title: ‘I’ll Never Try Again’: For Some Gazans, Seeking Aid Is Just Too Risky
summary: The Gaza health ministry said that more than 50 Palestinians were killed on Tuesday, and 20 on Monday, in violence around the new aid distribution system in the territory.

title: Lawmakers Vote to Decriminalize Abortions for Women in England and Wales
summary: The landmark decision will prevent women from being criminally prosecuted for ending their pregnancies.

title: South Africa Built a Medical Research Powerhouse. Trump Cuts Have Demolished It.
summary: The budget cuts threaten global progress on everything from heart disease to H.I.V. — and could affect American drug companies, too.

title: Obama Steps Back Into the Public Eye Amid Political and Global Unrest
summary: He will appear on Tuesday evening in Hartford, Conn., alongside the writer Heather Cox Richardson, at a time of deep volatility for his party, the country and the world.

title: U.S. Revokes Visa of Former Panamanian President Who Criticized Trump Deal
summary: Two politicians who spoke out against recent accords between the United States and Panama lost their permission to travel to the United States.

title: Members of Congress Press for More Security After Minnesota Attacks
summary: A Capitol security official briefed senators on enhanced security precautions, and lawmakers in both parties said more funding was needed to protect themselves.

title: What We Know About How the Minnesota Assassination Case May Unfold
summary: Both state and federal officials are pursuing murder charges against a man they say killed a state lawmaker and her husband. A federal case could lead to the death penalty.

title: They Said She Was Home-Schooled. She Said She Was Locked in a Dog Crate.
summary: A teenage girl fled her home last month after what she said was years of abuse. Prosecutors called what had happened to her “beyond heinous.”

title: Anne Burrell, Chef and Food Network Star, Dies at 55
summary: Her distinctive hairstyle and swagger in the kitchen made her one of America’s most recognizable Italian chefs.

title: Book Review: ‘Not My Type,’ by E. Jean Carroll
summary: Her lawyers urged that she keep her testimony short. With legal victories in hand, she’s sharing her life story, and what it was like on the stand.

title: Trump Is Daring Us to Impeach Him Again
summary: There are many legitimate reasons to try Trump a third time. Don’t hold your breath.

title: Sarah McBride on Why the Left Lost on Trans Rights
summary: Representative Sarah McBride reckons with the trans rights movement’s shortcomings, and how to win hearts and minds through a politics of grace.

title: Trump Called for Iran to Surrender
summary: Also, a New York City mayoral candidate was arrested by ICE agents. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Tell Us: How Are You Using A.I. at Work?
summary: Has A.I. become a part of your daily work routines? We want to know.

title: Supreme Court Justices Disclose International Travel and Book Deals
summary: Annual financial disclosures revealed some of the perks of being on the Supreme Court, including international teaching and book sales.

title: A Senator’s Fall From Grace Ends in a Grim Federal Lockup
summary: For decades, Robert Menendez, 71, was one of New Jersey’s most influential Democrats. He began serving an 11-year sentence on Tuesday.

title: Prison Kitchen Job Apparently Helped Ex-Police Chief Escape, Officials Say
summary: A job in a prison kitchen apparently helped Grant Hardin, a former police chief serving time for murder and rape, plot his escape by fashioning a makeshift police uniform, Arkansas prison officials said.

title: Visitors Break Crystal Chair in Sit-and-Run at Italian Museum
summary: They came. They sat. They left.
